alert.note: Alert for Henderson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 27 at 4:20AM EDT until May 28 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following county, Henderson. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of common, low-lying areas adjacent to streams is ongoing, including farmland, nurseries, greenways, and secondary roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 416 AM EDT, Earlier heavy rainfall of 2-4 inches has ended across Henderson County. No additional rainfall is expected. Most small streams have receded below critical levels. However, Mud Creek near Hendersonville remains above Minor Flood Stage, impacting farmland, nurseries, greenways, and other low-lying areas adjacent to Mud Creek near Kanuga Rd and Erkwood Dr to southern Hendersonville and the Oklawaha Greenway. Mud Creek has crested at 9.5 feet and is currently 9.3 feet and falling slowly. Mud Creek will slowly recede over the next several hours and is expected to fall below Minor Flood Stage later this morning. High flows are also occurring along the Green River and flooding within the Green River Gorge is likely as well over the next several hours. - Some locations that may continue to experience flooding include... Hendersonville, Flat Rock, Mountain Home, Laurel Park, Saluda, Valley Hill, East Flat Rock, Crab Creek, and Tuxedo.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
